item.title: Nick add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nick add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Nick add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Nick add a quote by Robert Blair
item.description: "A different world cannot be built by indifferent people." -- Robert Blair

item.title: Nick add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nick add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Nick add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Nick add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "Books act like a developing fluid on film. That is, they bring into consciousness what you didnâ€™t know you knew." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Nick add a quote by Robert Maynard Hutchins
item.description: "Nobody can decide for himself whether he is going to be a human being. The only question open to him is whether he will be an ignorant undeveloped one or one who has sought to reach the highest point he is capable of attaining." -- Robert Maynard Hutchins

item.title: Nick add a quote by Laurence Sterne
item.description: "I have undertaken, you see, to write not only my life, but my opinions also; hoping and expecting that your knowledge of my character, and of what kind of a mortal I am, by the one, would give you a better relish for the other: As you proceed further with me, the slight acquaintance which is now beginning betwixt us, will grow into familiarity; and that, unless one of us is in fault, will terminate in friendship." -- Laurence Sterne

item.title: Nick add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "How do I know what I think until I see what I say?" -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Nick add a quote by Jesse Lee Bennett
item.description: "Books are the compasses and telescopes and sextants and charts which other men have prepared to help us navigate the dangerous seas of human life." -- Jesse Lee Bennett

item.title: Nick add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "A life not lived for others is not a life." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Nick add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis
